item.title: The Raft Consensus Protocol
item.description: Context Imagine we want to build a stateful service like a KV store. A KV store is useful because it can persist user preference across stateless HTTP sessions. Once a user has specified his/her preferences, the website do not have to ask again next time the same user visits the website. Buidling the KV store with only one node is relatively simple because the node cannot disagree with itself. The client can ask the service to save a value, when it asks the server for the value back, the service only needs to fetch the value from the only node.
